item.description: Walk a portion of the Canalside Rail Trail from the Farren Care Center on Montague City Road in Turners Falls, MA to the rail yard in South Deerfield, with a possible side trip along the Migratory Way. The trail section we plan to walk  intersects Montague City Road near the Farren Care Center and continues over the old railroad bridge across the Connecticut River, past part of the nursery fields for Stewart's nursery, and terminates at the train yard in South Deerfield. This is an out-and-back trip, should take about an hours, maybe a little more;  if we still have energy we can cross the 11th street bridge in Turners and walk the other side of the canal along Migratory Way to see the various birds that rest in the waters ahead of the power station. This walk is on flat, paved roads the whole way. Kristi's cell is 413-695-9848 if all else fails. -- Kristi
item.how_to_find_us: I have a black lab w/blue leash, & vanilla PT Cruiser; will be parked in the lot across from the Farren Care Center on Montague City Road, Turners

group.name: Western Mass Dogs - Walks and more!

item.name: Canalside Rail Trail: Over the River to see the Trains
